comment: * This evaluator can be used to perform type interpolation between float[] values. * Each index into the array is treated as a separate value to interpolate. For example, * evaluating {100, 200} and {300, 400} will interpolate the value at * the first index between 100 and 300 and the value at the second index value between 200 and 400.

methods.name: public float[] evaluate(float fraction, float[] startValue, float[] endValue)
methods.comment: * Interpolates the value at each index by the fraction. If * {@link #FloatArrayEvaluator(float[])} was used to construct this object, * reuseArray will be returned, otherwise a new float[] * will be returned. * * @param fraction The fraction from the starting to the ending values * @param startValue The start value. * @param endValue The end value. * @return A float[] where each element is an interpolation between * the same index in startValue and endValue.

methodNames: public float[] evaluate(float fraction, float[] startValue, float[] endValue)
